summary: Issue #2726 is a false positive. The fix for issue #2097 already correctly handles the case where literal r'\n' text and actual newline characters produce distinguishable outputs. No code changes needed - only added comprehensive regression test to verify correct behavior.
findings: Literal r'\n' (2 chars) correctly outputs r'\\n' (3 chars)
Actual newline '\n' correctly outputs r'\n' (2 chars)
No collision exists between literal text and sanitized control characters
